warmup.content:
# Warmup
---

Create a simple HTML directory from scratch. Include:

1. **index.html** page
2. **styles folder** with a **main.css**
3. **js folder** with a **main.js**

**Make sure** to include **[Semantic UI](https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/semantic-ui/2.2.4/semantic.min.css)** and **[jQuery](https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.1.0/jquery.min.js)** appropriately in the **index.html**.

#### Exercises
---

Create a button that, on click, will turn the background color of your page red. 

**Stretch goal**: make the color changing toggle!

Create an input field that, when typed into, will read the value of the field and print it into a div right below.

ui-components.content:
# UI Components
---

The jQuery Mantra:

1. Identify and select the thing you want to do stuff to.
2. Then, run jQuery functions on the thing you selected.

**[jQuery Docs](https://api.jquery.com/)**

#### Accordion
---

When a title is clicked, display content. When title is clicked again, hide the content.

#### Dropdown
---

When chosen item is hovered, show options. When not hovered, remove options. If option is clicked, remove options.

#### Dynamic Divs
---

Input field, when you hit enter, takes content and creates a div on page dynamically. Clicking this div will alert contents of this div.

plugins.content:
# Plugins
---

Plugins: additional functions written by third party developers that allow you to get complex ui components into your page easily.

#### How to pick a plugin
---

A few questions to ask yourself:

1. Does it have good documentation?
2. How many stars does it have on github? (Or, have others used it? Is it written by a reputable company? etc)
3. When was the last time it was updated? Is it in active development? Is it a dead project?
4. How many bugs does it have reported?
5. Does it actualy do what you want? Is it easy to get the functionality that you need?


#### [jQuery Plugin Mecca](http://www.unheap.com/)
